meanings.definition: Something that causes inconvenience or trouble.
meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy bags can be an incommodity for some people.
meanings.sent2: The lack of parking spaces in the city is an incommodity for residents.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can turn into an incommodity.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise outside became an incommodity to her peaceful reading time.
meanings.sent5: The broken elevator turned into an incommodity for the residents of the building.

meanings.sent1: The remote location of the cabin was an incommodity for those without a car.
meanings.sent2: The incommodity of having to wait in long lines at the airport can be frustrating.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting your umbrella on a rainy day can lead to an unexpected incommodity.
meanings.sent4: The outdated technology in the office was an incommodity in the fast-paced industry.
meanings.sent5: The lack of air conditioning in the heatwave created an incommodity for the employees.
